summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from July 22, 2020, covering a wide range of national news topics. It includes sections on protests, counter-terrorism, counter-intelligence, criminal investigations, and other FBI news. Notably, it contains updates on the Ghislaine Maxwell case, including a federal judge considering releasing her testimony and her lawyers seeking a gag order. It also reports on the FBI probing links between attacks on a New Jersey federal judge and a California attorney.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: British socialite and former girlfriend of Jeffrey Epstein, facing charges of sex trafficking and conspiracy. Her lawyers are seeking a gag order in her criminal case, and a judge is considering releasing her sealed testimony from a 2015 civil suit.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier accused of sex trafficking. Mentioned as Maxwell's former boyfriend and co-conspirator.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: One of Epstein's accusers who filed a defamation lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell in 2015.

persons.name: Loretta Preska
persons.context: U.S. District Judge in New York who scheduled a conference to discuss unsealing documents from Giuffre's 2015 lawsuit against Maxwell.

persons.name: Alison Nathan
persons.context: U.S. District Judge presiding over Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case. Her lawyers asked her to issue a gag order.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: A lawyer for Ghislaine Maxwell who filed a letter requesting a gag order in her criminal case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York. Cited in Maxwell's lawyer's request for a gag order due to public comments.

persons.name: William Sweeney
persons.context: Head of the FBI's New York office. Cited in Maxwell's lawyer's request for a gag order for comments comparing Maxwell to a snake.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in a brief news item where he was asked about Ghislaine Maxwell, said he hadn't followed her case, had met her numerous times, and wished her well.

persons.name: Esther Salas
persons.context: New Jersey federal judge whose son was killed and husband injured in a shooting at her home. The FBI is investigating links to a California murder.

persons.name: Roy Den Hollander
persons.context: A lawyer and self-described anti-feminist who is the prime suspect in the attack on Judge Salas's family and is being investigated for the murder of a California attorney.

persons.name: Marc Angelucci
persons.context: A men's rights attorney murdered in California on July 11, 2020. The FBI is investigating Roy Den Hollander as a suspect in his killing.

persons.name: Daniel Anderl
persons.context: 20-year-old son of Judge Esther Salas, killed in the shooting at their home.

persons.name: Mark Anderl
persons.context: Husband of Judge Esther Salas, injured in the shooting at their home.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as Epstein's ex-girlfriend and alleged co-conspirator in sex trafficking.
Giuffre sued Maxwell for defamation in 2015, claiming Maxwell called her a liar regarding Epstein allegations.
Den Hollander had a case presided over by Judge Salas in 2015 before another lawyer took over in 2019.
The FBI is investigating Den Hollander as the prime suspect in the murder of attorney Marc Angelucci.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in Bradford, New Hampshire, on sex trafficking and conspiracy charges related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Murder of Marc Angelucci
events.description: Men's rights attorney Marc Angelucci was shot to death at his home in San Bernardino County, California.

events.title: Shooting at Judge Salas's Home
events.description: A gunman posing as a FedEx delivery man shot and killed Judge Esther Salas's son, Daniel Anderl, and injured her husband, Mark Anderl, at their New Jersey home.

events.title: Maxwell Gag Order Request
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's lawyer, Jeffrey Pagliuca, filed a request for a gag order on prosecutors, FBI agents, and lawyers for alleged victims in her criminal case.

events.title: Scheduled Conference on Maxwell Testimony
events.description: Judge Loretta Preska scheduled a conference to discuss unsealing previously sealed records from Virginia Giuffre's 2015 defamation lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: A federal judge is considering unsealing Ghislaine Maxwell's testimony about her sex life from a 2015 civil lawsuit.
Maxwell's lawyers have requested a gag order in her criminal case, citing public comments by the Acting U.S. Attorney and the head of the FBI's New York office.
The FBI is investigating links between the attack on New Jersey federal judge Esther Salas's family and the murder of California attorney Marc Angelucci, with Roy Den Hollander as the prime suspect.
President Trump commented on Ghislaine Maxwell, saying he hadn't followed her case, had met her numerous times, and wished her well.
The body of Alonzo Brooks, a cold case featured on Netflix, was exhumed in Kansas as the FBI investigates his death as a possible hate crime.
